div.b: Hit the button to get the symbols...

ul.li: You can nest as many of this as you want. e.g. <A< this has two nested senses <a< sense 1 >1> and <2< sense 2 >2> >A>
The order of the section uses at the first level Upper Case letters, at the second level numbers, at the third level lower case letters and at the third level Greek letters.
To specify the language of use <Ade< .... >A> for example, where de is the ISO 639-1 code for that language.

div.p: You might use this to enter your own links. For example to link to another lemma, or to link to an entity in BM. You could also use it to link to any other resource on the web.

div.div: (Dillmann 2 a) on click you will be brought there. on hover the pointed sense will be highlighted with a shadow.

div.p: You might use this to enter refernces to other parts of the main entry. The identifier is build looking at the numbers actually given, so, if a sense has only a b c, then you may refer to #Da, #Db, etc. for the main sense, or its entirety, use #Dmain, #Tmain, #Lmain.
You might use this to mark up instances of reference to a specific subtype of verb.

div.a: Paris, Bibliothèque nationale de France, BnF Éthiopien 143

div.p: You might use this to enter quickly links to Beta maṣāḥǝft. Please make sure you stick to BM in upper case as this is what is used. Also make sure that the identifier which you provide exists and is correct. You do not need to provide the title, it will be printed requesting from Beta maṣāḥǝft the most up to date title available for that resource.

ul.li: Use one of Dillmann's abbreviation and you will get the tooltip explaining it.

Try also ((vid.)) \*gez*ሐሊባ፡\* to get a direct link to the form you enter, like vid. ሐሊባ፡ . If you use this and wish to enter more terms after vid, please use a comma to separate the words as in ((vid.)) \*gez*ገብር፡\*, \*gez*መስቀል፡\*

tr.td: Versio Latina Jubilaeorum libri, exstat in libro: Monumenta sacra et profana e codicibus Bibl. Ambrosianae tom. I, fasc. I. ed Ceriani, Mediol. 1861. 4°.
Laurence, Henochi, IV Ezrae, Asc. Jesaiae librorum editor.
Radices Abbadianae (collectio radicum Geez linguae Mss.).

div.div: anything you put here, transformed as described here.

ul.li: There is no need to nest these. Use it just to group information.
See below case, gender and PoS.
PLEASE DO NOT CONFUSE WITH THE ENCODING OF TEXT WHICH IS SIMPLY IN ANOTHER LANGUAGE IN THE ENTRY, WITH RESPECT TO THE MAIN LANGUAGE OF THE SENSE!!!!
Remember to specify the language according to the ISO 639-1 code for languages.
Remember to specify the language according to the ISO 639-1 code for languages.
This is fine for anything which is not a translation. it simply says: here is a piece of text in another language.
Notice, the app will know that this is in Syriac.
Remember to specify the language according to the ISO 639-1 code for languages.
Eventually, if there is a text, you will see in the popup the line(s) you are quoting.
you might find also this notation *Kuf. |35*p.|, this is for where a unit is specified by Dillmann.
If there is no exact passage, please leave the second part of the notation empy. e.g. *Kuf.|*
A reference SHOULD NOT contain an abbreviation, it is in fact already, and the expanded form should be registered as well in the abbreviations list.

Parts of works for which there is an abbreviation should use that. *Asc. Jes. ed. Laur.|78*p.| is ok. ((ho.)) Theodoti Ancyr. in *Cyr.|102*f.| because the work cited here is the one abbreviated by Cyr. which contains the ho. Theodoti Ancyr. which does not have an id and a canonical abbreviation
Unless there is something to fix, it is very unlikely that you are going to use this
You can use this to make a simple column reference into a link to that column, which is useful if the entry starts several columns before.

ul.li: The bm: part must be a unique tag in the Ethio Studies Group Zotero Library!
If you only want to give a reference to a work omit the [] part, simply add bm:Dillmann1857Gramm
p., s., n. $ before comma will be normalized to the allowed values of citedRange page, item and paragraph respectively.

for pages, lines and line ranges use this synthax: [page, 50:3; 51:3-4; 52:6] where a sequence of citation ranges is separated with semicolumn, lines and pages are separated by column and ranges are indicated with hyphen.
This must be inside a gramGrp element! e.g. [[+refl.+ @acc.@ ˆm.ˆ]]

div.div: This is an elment not defined by TEI, but added to the schem from TraCES

ul.li: This should be in any entry which is not in Dillmann. You can click the button to add it.
Do you really need this? I doubt, but there are things there which are not better specified. Perhaps specify them in one of the above or suggest something new!
